title: SolarWinds: The Supply Chain Attack That Shook the World
description: A micro-lesson that makes SolarWinds: The Supply Chain Attack That Shook the World usable.

hook.text: Hackers compromised a software update and instantly gained access to 18,000 organizations, including the U.S. Treasury.

buildup.text: Russia's SVR embedded malware into SolarWinds' Orion platform update â€” trusted software used by Fortune 500 companies.

discovery.text: Every organization that installed the update unknowingly opened a backdoor. The attackers chose their targets carefully.

twist.text: FireEye discovered the breach only because attackers stole their own red team tools â€” getting greedy was their mistake.

climax.text: SolarWinds proved that trust in the software supply chain is itself a vulnerability.

punchline.text: They hid inside a software update you were told to install.

quiz.question: How did the SolarWinds attack work?
